creator: med1985@gmail.com
text: A document level cache would help improve the performance of the system and also help reduce the memory of the output PDF.

creator: bowditch_chris@hotmail.com
text:
Mehdi,

Can you elaborate? The new policy of raising bugs for each change is defeated if you only add 1 cryptic line to the bug report. By reducing memory of the PDF, do you mean the size of the PDF? Caches will typically use more JVM heap rather than less...

Thanks,

Chris

creator: med1985@gmail.com
text:
Hahaha. Yeah, that's probably not the best description. I think my brain has started to take Fridays as a holiday...

I meant it reduce the file-size of the output PDF by re-using cached pages and their resources if the same page is embedded multiple times within a PDF.
